1.name: Catch-22
1.description: A man is trying desperately to be certified insane during World War II, so he can stop flying missions.

2.name: The AristoCats
2.description: With the help of a smooth talking tomcat, a family of Parisian felines set to inherit a fortune from their owner try to make it back home after a jealous butler kidnaps them and leaves them in the country.

3.name: MASH
3.description: The staff of a Korean War field hospital use humor and high jinks to keep their sanity in the face of the horror of war.

4.name: Patton
4.description: The World War II phase of the career of the controversial American general, George S. Patton.

5.name: El Topo
5.description: A mysterious black-clad gunfighter wanders a mystical Western landscape encountering multiple bizarre characters.

6.name: Love Story
6.description: A boy and a girl from different backgrounds fall in love regardless of their upbringing - and then tragedy strikes.

7.name: Kelly's Heroes
7.description: A group of U.S. soldiers sneaks across enemy lines to get their hands on a secret stash of Nazi treasure.

8.name: Two Mules for Sister Sara
8.description: Nun Sara is on the run in Mexico and is saved from cowboys by Hogan, who is preparing for a future mission to capture a French fort. The pair become good friends, but Sara never does tell him the true reason behind her being outlawed.

9.name: Beyond the Valley of the Dolls
9.description: Three girls come to Hollywood to make it big, but find only sex, drugs and sleaze.

10.name: Little Big Man
10.description: Jack Crabb, looking back from extreme old age, tells of his life being raised by Native Americans and fighting with General Custer.

11.name: Gas! -Or- It Became Necessary to Destroy the World in Order to Save It.
11.description: A gas is let loose upon the world that kills anyone over 25 years old.

12.name: There Was a Crooked Man...
12.description: A charming but totally ruthless criminal is sent to a remote Arizona prison. He enlists the help of his cellmates in an escape attempt with the promise of sharing his hidden loot.

13.name: The Conformist
13.description: A weak-willed Italian man becomes a fascist flunky who goes abroad to arrange the assassination of his old teacher, now a political dissident.

14.name: Five Easy Pieces
14.description: A dropout from upper-class America picks up work along the way on oil rigs when his life isn't spent in a squalid succession of bars, motels, and other points of interest.

15.name: Hercules in New York
15.description: Hercules (Schwarzenegger) is sent to Earth where he finds true love and starts a promising career in the bodybuilder business.

16.name: They Call Me Trinity
16.description: A lazy, unorthodox gunfighter and his portly, horse-thieving brother defend a Mormon settlement from a land-grabbing Major, a Mexican bandit, and their henchmen.

17.name: Waterloo
17.description: Facing the decline of everything he has worked to obtain, conqueror Napoleon Bonaparte and his army confront the British at the Battle of Waterloo.

18.name: Zabriskie Point
18.description: At Zabriskie Point, United States' lowest point, two perfect strangers meet; an undergraduate dreamer and a young hippie student who start off an unrestrained romance, making love on the dusty terrain.

19.name: Wanda
19.description: Wanda, a lonely housewife, drifts through mining country until she meets a petty thief who takes her in.

20.name: Rio Lobo
20.description: After the Civil War, Cord McNally searches for the traitor whose treachery caused the defeat of McNally's unit and the loss of a close friend.

21.name: Airport
21.description: A bomber on board an airplane, an airport almost closed by snow, and various personal problems of the people involved.

22.name: The Railway Children
22.description: After the enforced absence of their father, three children move with their mother to Yorkshire, where during their adventures they attempt to discover the reason for his disappearance.

23.name: Tora! Tora! Tora!
23.description: In 1941, following months of economic embargo, Japan prepares to open its war against the United States with a preventive strike on the US naval base at Pearl Harbor.

24.name: Performance
24.description: A violent gangster seeks refuge from the mob in the Bohemian home of a former rock star.

25.name: Ryan's Daughter
25.description: Set in the wake of the 1916 Easter Rising, a married woman in a small Irish village has an affair with a troubled British officer.

26.name: Soldier Blue
26.description: After a cavalry patrol is ambushed by the Cheyenne, the two survivors, a soldier and a woman, must reach the safety of the nearest fort.

27.name: The Bird with the Crystal Plumage
27.description: An American writer and his English girlfriend are stalked by a serial killer terrorizing Rome after the former witnesses a murder attempt on a woman's life.

28.name: When Dinosaurs Ruled the Earth
28.description: Set in the ancient past when humans and dinosaurs lived together, a small tribe is struggling to survive by giving a sacrifice of a blond woman to their god, the sun, in return for ...                See full summary »

29.name: Beneath the Planet of the Apes
29.description: The sole survivor of an interplanetary rescue mission searches for the only survivor of the previous expedition. He discovers a planet ruled by apes and an underground city run by telepathic humans.

30.name: Valerie a týden divu
30.description: Inspired by fairy-tales such as Alice in Wonderland and Little Red-Riding Hood, "Valerie and her Week of Wonders" is a surreal tale in which love, fear, sex and religion merge into one fantastic world.

31.name: Le Cercle Rouge
31.description: After leaving prison, master thief Corey crosses paths with a notorious escapee and an alcoholic former policeman. The trio proceed to plot an elaborate heist.

32.name: The Cheyenne Social Club
32.description: An aging cowboy finds to his embarrassment that the successful business he has inherited from his brother is actually a house of prostitution.

33.name: The Vampire Lovers
33.description: Seductive vampire Carmilla Karnstein and her family target the beautiful and the rich in a remote area of late eighteenth-century Gemany.

34.name: Colossus: The Forbin Project
34.description: Thinking this will prevent war, the US government gives an impenetrable supercomputer total control over launching nuclear missiles. But what the computer does with the power is unimaginable to its creators.

35.name: Chisum
35.description: Cattle baron John Chisum joins forces with Billy the Kid and Pat Garrett to fight the Lincoln County land war.

36.name: Myra Breckinridge
36.description: After undergoing gender reassignment surgery, an aspiring actress travels to Hollywood, where she also wants to make a claim on her wealthy uncle's estate.

37.name: The Private Life of Sherlock Holmes
37.description: When a bored Holmes eagerly takes the case of Gabrielle Valladon after an attempt on her life, the search for her missing husband leads to Loch Ness and the legendary monster.

38.name: Deep End
38.description: 15-year-old dropout Mike takes a job at Newford Baths, where inappropriate sexual behaviour abounds, and becomes obsessed with his coworker Susan.

39.name: Mark of the Devil
39.description: In 1700s Austria, a witch-hunter's apprentice has doubts about the righteousness of witch-hunting when he witnesses the brutality, the injustice, the falsehood, the torture and the arbitrary killing that go with the job.

40.name: Trog
40.description: A sympathetic anthropologist uses drugs and surgery to try to communicate with a primitive troglodyte who is found living in a local cave.

41.name: A Man Called Horse
41.description: In 1825, an English aristocrat is captured by Native Americans. He lives with them and begins to understand their way of life. Eventually, he is accepted as part of the tribe and aspires to become their leader.

42.name: Joe
42.description: Two men, Bill, a wealthy conservative, and Joe, a far-right factory worker, form a dangerous bond after Bill confesses to murdering his daughter's drug dealer boyfriend to Joe.

43.name: The Ballad of Cable Hogue
43.description: A hobo accidentally stumbles onto a water spring, and creates a profitable way station in the middle of the desert.

44.name: Claire's Knee
44.description: On lakeside summer holiday, a conflicted older man is dared to have a flirt with two beautiful teenage stepsisters despite his betrothal to a diplomat's daughter and the fact that the girls have boyfriends.

45.name: Bigfoot
45.description: Bigfoot kidnaps some women and some bikers decide to go on a rescue mission to save them.

46.name: Brewster McCloud
46.description: An introverted loner living in the bowels of the Astrodome plots to develop - with the aid of a mysterious guardian angel - a pair of wings that will help him fly.

47.name: Husbands
47.description: After the death of a common friend, three married men leave their lives together, seeking pleasure and freedom and ultimately leaving for London.

48.name: Hi, Mom!
48.description: A Vietnam vet moves into an apartment and views in other people's windows across the street, meets one of the women, and discovers black theater.

49.name: Ned Kelly
49.description: Based on a true story, Ned Kelly is unable to support his family in the Australian outback, he turns to stealing horses in order to make money. He gets more deeply drawn into the outlaw ...                See full summary »

50.name: The Games
50.description: Four marathon runners (one from England, one from the U.S., a Czechoslovakian, and an Australian Aborigine) prepare to run in the Olympic games. The film follows each one and shows what their motivations are for running in the games.
